thread.title: BRW Rich List 2015: Australia’s richest families revealed
thread.title_full: BRW Rich List 2015: Australia’s richest families revealed | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: Jane Harper
title: BRW Rich List 2015: Australia’s richest families revealed
text:
MELBOURNE’S minted Smorgon family has been named the country’s richest for the seventh year with a $2.7 billion fortune.
The family, which has a diverse range of investments across property, agriculture, fashion and cosmetics, topped the 2015 BRW Rich Families list as their wealth held firm from last year’s $2.7 billion.
The Wilson family, who hold the majority share in listed building and hardware group Reece Australia, ranked second with wealth of $2.6 billion.
Melbourne property and technology investors the Liberman family came third with a $2.5 billion fortune. Reece CEO Peter Wilson with fellow family board members Bruce and John Wilson. The family is Australia’s second richest. Source: News Corp Australia
Start of sidebar. Skip to end of sidebar.

Return to start of sidebar.
More rich families choose to live in Victoria than anywhere else in the country, with the state home to 17 families on the list, ahead of New South Wales’s 16.
The combined wealth of the top 50 families has hit $41.18 billion this year, up from up from $40.1 billion a year ago and $35 billion the year before.
The average wealth on the list is $824 million per family, the highest ever result.
Three debutants join the list this year, led by Melbourne’s Ring family in 31st position with wealth of $440 million. The Ring family burst onto the scene this year on the back of the majority sale of the Swisse Wellness vitamins company in September.
“More than 70 per cent of Australian companies identify as family businesses,” BRW Rich List editor John Stensholt says. “This year it’s interesting to see the shift in investment as many of our wealthiest families move to property to boost their already considerable wealth.”
The Smorgon Family Building at the Peter Macallum Cancer Centre in East Melbourne. Picture: Andrew Batsch Source: News Corp Australia
David Smorgon, a member of the top ranking family and also executive chairman of PricewaterhouseCooper’s family, business and wealth team, told BRW that a healthy family dynamic was crucial. “There is too much emphasis on business matters at the expense of family issues,” he told BRW.
“A successful family business requires hard work, commitment, collaboration and understanding.”
Originally published as Nation’s richest families revealed
